page.title: 18RELIGION Conformist
page.content: Many religions have their own places of worship in Burgess Hill. There are three{Anglican}churches. The oldest building was St.John's Chapel which was replaced by St.John's Church in the early nineteenth century. It was built on the original St.John's common that covered most of the West of the town. It still uses its bells. St.Andrew's church was then built in the East of the town, and in 1960 St.Edward's church was build on part of St.John's churchyard. All of the churches have a Sunday School. { { }St.Wilfrid's{Roman Catholic}Church was built around 1940. The original church was extended in 1961. There is a carved statue of St.Wilfrid the patron saint of Sussex in the church. It is said that the wood used for it is a piece of ship's wood dating back to the 13th century.
